text:
Objects served through httpd-2.0.39 from tomcat-4.0.3 via mod_webapp-4.0.4 
appear to be sending a status of 0 to the browser (instead of 200).  Netscape 4 
and IE 4 complain about the status returns of 0.  IE5+ and Netscape 6+ don't 
seem to care (I haven't tried any other browsers).

Unfortunately, my offending server is an internal resource, so I can't give you 
a URL.

I don't know if this bug should be reported to the httpd team or to the tomcat 
team.  For now, I'm just reporting it to httpd.

Server Config:
Apache-2.0.39
mod_webapp from jakarta-tomcat-connectors-4.0.4-src
Tomcat 4.0.3
Sun Solaris 8 (Ultra 2 hardware)

Browser config:
Netscape v4.79
WinNt v4.0 SP6
creator: rberglin@kcp.com

text:
"mod_webapp is deprecated and unsupported due to lack of developer interest.
Please use mod_jk, or jk2"
creator: funkman@joedog.org
